page.title: 01Aird of Sleat, Isle of Skye
page.content: Half of this block covers the southern tip of the Isle of Skye, the crofting townships of Aird of Sleat and the Point of Sleat; the other half is sea. The land is mostly rocky peat-covered hillocks up to 150 metres high, with one small lock and lots of streams. The area is geologically important containing the most southerly land extremity of Moine Thrust. Aird is a relatively thriving crofting township, but few crofters earn their living solely from this. There are several holiday houses and a couple of bed and breakfast houses. A new sheep fank was built in 1984 in 1984 and fences repaired.
